notice.ch: 研究所領域分類：材料類

department.ch: 化學工程與材料工程學系

remark.ch: 研究所領域分類：材料類

goal.ch: 本課所用教材以英文為主，進而提高學生閱讀能力，並且培養學生具有：(1) 國際觀(瞭解現在最熱寧的領域，閱讀國外期刊) (2) 整合能力(自我閱讀英文論文，做出有條理的簡報) (3) 表達能力(在報告時會依簡報設計，參考文獻，英文拼字，內容，流暢度，手勢，自信，發音，眼神交會，聲量，邏輯，思路清晰度，語調，深度及回答問題好壞來做評分。) (4) 創造力(是否把所學運用在自己研究上，能否把枯燥的題目變得生動) (5) 領導的能力(掌控完成報告所需時間，報告的品質管理，自訂報告的內容)。此外上課的文獻就生物啟發材料的五大特色，可分成八個單元，每個單元都涵蓋三部分：(1)生物啟發的特色，(2)生活中可以利用生物啟發材料來解決問題，(3)生物啟發材料的解決方法。學生通過對這八個單元所做的個人研讀，可以對生物啟發材料有更廣與更深的了解。希望學生能舉一反三，運用在自己的研究範疇。
goal.en:
“Biomaterials have been around for a long time.  They have evolved into many superb functional materials under the process of natural selection.  Therefore, using them as an inspirational source is very common to scientists.  Although many biomedical materials or active pharmaceutical ingredients are derived from natural products, only a few of the synthetic materials, composite materials and advanced functional materials based on bio-inspiration are discovered and designed in the areas of materials science and engineering.  It becomes more important than ever to investigate bio-inspired materials and technology nowadays.  We have collected more than 45 papers from different journals (ex: International Journal of Pharmaceutical, Journal of Physics D: Applied Physics, Nature and Science, etc.) in this course covering disciplines such as molecular biology, chemistry, physics, chemical engineering, polymers, semiconductors, optoelectronics and pharmaceutical engineering, investigating the materials structure from nanometer scale all the way to micron level.  We will devote our time to six important features in bio-inspiration: chirality, polymorphism, self-assembly, molecular recognition, patterning, and hierarchical structures, by bottom-up fabrication.
All teaching and reading materials are written in English.  Hopefully, the reading abilities of students will be elevated.  Students are expected to cultivate: (1) international views (i.e. by following the current trend in research and reading foreign journals), (2) integration skills (i.e. by studying the papers independently and preparing logical power-point presentations), (3) communication skills (i.e. the grading of presentation is based on presentation design, references, spellings, contents, fluency, gestures, confidence, punctuality, eye contact, voice level, logics, clarity, modulation, depth and answers to questions), (4) innovation (i.e. applying the knowledge on the research and turning a boring subject into an interesting topic), and (5) leadership (i.e. time management, spontaneity, presentation design).  The five key features of bio-inspiration are divided into eight modules, and each module is composed of three parts: (1) the uniqueness of bio-inspiration, (2) real-life problems which can be solved by bio-inspired materials and technology, and (3) solutions offered by bio-inspired materials and technology.  Thorough the personal study of these eight modules, students can gain understandings of bio-inspired materials and technology.  We hope students can eventually reason and think on their own, and to apply the insight in their own research areas.“

outline.ch: “Bioinspired Materials and Technology Fall 2021Host: Prof. Tu LeeTime: Fridays 9:00 – 11:50 a.m.Place: Engineering Building 1, E233This is an English speaking, intensive reading course. Biology or biochemistry background is NOT required. The course is divided into eight different modules (Table 1) and the reading assignments for each module is shown in references.Students are expected to read All assignments and to present of what they read in a 5 to 10-page power point format. Different specific presentation topics will be assigned in the class. There will be a total of 7 presentations (one presentation/module on average) for each student. Each presentation is worth 10 ％. There will be a 20-min Midterm Presentation on a special topic which is worth 15 ％. There will also be a Final Term Paper and Presentation on a special topic of 15 ％. The final decision on the topics of Midterm Presentation and Final Term Paper MUST be made by a thorough discussion between students and the professor before 11/12/2021 and 12/24/2021, respectively. The format of the presentation and the term paper will be announced in the class. Table 1. SyllabusWeek of Module09/17 Orientation09/24 110/02 1 10/09 210/15 210/22 310/29 311/05 411/12 411/19 No Class (TwIChE)11/26 Midterm Presentation12/03 512/10 512/17 612/24 612/31 No Class (Holiday)01/07 701/14 Final Term Paper ＆ Final Presentation“

gradMethod.ch: “There will be a total of 7 presentations, and each presentation is worth 10 ％.  There will be a 20-min Midterm Presentation on a special topic which is worth 15 ％.  There will also be a Final Term Paper and Presentation on a special topic of 15 ％.“
